name: twirl
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] to turn something quickly several times: He twirled the ribbon around the stick. He twirled his umbrella as he walked. She twirled her baton high in the air as she led the parade.
[ I, usually + adv/prep ] to give a sudden quick turn or set of turns in a circle: She danced and twirled across the room. The dancers hopped and wiggled and twirled around the stage.

the act of giving something a quick turn or set of turns, or of suddenly turning quickly: She did a twirl in her new skirt. He gave a twirl of his cane.
